#summary Bayeux response codes
= Introduction =

List of Bayeux error/response codes.  Includes constant, closest matching HTTP response code, and response text.  


= Details =

The error field will take the form of:  (from protocol doc)

{{{
error            = error_code ":" error_args ":" error_message 
                 | error_code ":" ":" error_message
error_code       = digit digit digit
error_args       = string * "," string )
error_message    = string
}}}


Example:
{{{
[
  {
     "channel": "/meta/invalidchannel",
     "successful": false,
     "error": "405:/meta/invalidchannel:The meta channel specified is not valid.",
     "clientId": "Un1q31d3nt1f13r",
     "timestamp": "12:00:00 1970"
   }
]
}}}


List of error codes is below:

 
|| *code* || *constant* || *message* || *sample* ||
||400||RC_BAD_REQUEST||Invalid request.||"400:/meta/subscribe::Invalid request."||
||401||RC_INVALID_CLIENTID||Invalid client id.||"401::The client ID specified is not valid."||
||403||RC_CHANNEL_FORBIDDEN||Access to the specified channel is forbidden.||"403:/topic/noaccess:Access to the specified channel is forbidden."||
||404||RC_UNKNOWN_CHANNEL||The channel specified is unknown.||"404:/channel/noexist:The channel specified is unknown."||
||405||RC_INVALID_CHANNEL||The channel specified is not valid.||"405:/meta/badchannel:The channel specified is not valid."||
